page.title: 15BURSCOUGH ARMY UNIT
page.content: This is an Army Stores Depot which supplies equipment mainly to the 120 army units in Lancashire. The Depot was begun in 1891 and now covers 27.5acres and has 37 buildings. These are mostly large stores but there are also offices a guardroom,a building where guard dogs are kept and a garage for maintaining vehicles.The army keeps everything a soldier needs to live and to fight. This ranges from cups,spoons, and beds, for barracks or married quarters, to personal clothing and equipment as well as blankets and tents for use in the field. There is also a large store for such things as: sandbags and barbed wire. The officer in charge has the rank of Major and under him there are more than 50 civilians. Eight of these are women who work in the offices. The camp is manned 24 hours a day.
